Yes, smaller Baptist churches can work together and support each other to prevent decline. This can take many forms, such as joint programs, events, and outreach initiatives. Collaborating on shared services and resources can also help smaller churches to operate more efficiently and effectively.

In addition, there are various initiatives and groups that can provide support and networking opportunities for smaller Baptist churches, such as regional or denominational associations, fellowships, and training programs. These resources can help smaller churches to overcome challenges and grow in health and vitality.

Ultimately, it will require a spirit of cooperation and collaboration among Baptist churches, both large and small, to ensure that the Baptist tradition remains vibrant and relevant in the years to come.
